page.title: 12FARMING IN THE HUNTLY AREA
page.content: Huntly has a mart. Some farmers buy locally. They travel 30 miles, others travel 200 miles. On a good day 700 cattle are sold. Main sheep sales are in Autumn. Main cattle sales are in Spring and Autumn. Store cattle costÂ£200_Â£700.Store lambs cost Â£30_Â£35.Breeding sheep cost Â£45_Â£50.There are 3 computers and 2 printers in the mart office.Farmers pay by cheque.Machinery and furniture are also sold.Mart day is Wednesday.In Autumn it is every day except Monday,Friday and Saturday.The mart has 5 clerks 1 cashier and 5 auctioneers. There are branches from Wick and Thurso to Aberdeen and Aboyne.One farmer attends special sales.He travels 10 miles to the mart.He buys cattle and sheep but only sells sheep.
